derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin prohibitio(n-), from prohibere 'keep in check' (see prohibit)

entry.def: A prohibition is a law or rule forbidding something.

example.ex: ...prohibitions against feeding birds at the airport.
example.tran: 禁止在机场养鸟的法令

means.word_mean: 1. a law forbidding the sale of alcoholic beverages;

sentences.sentence: "in 1920 the 18th amendment to the Constitution established prohibition in the US"

means.word_mean: 3. the period from 1920 to 1933 when the sale of alcoholic beverages was prohibited in the United States by a constitutional amendment
4. refusal to approve or assent to
5. the action of prohibiting or inhibiting or forbidding (or an instance thereof);

sentences.sentence: "they were restrained by a prohibition in their charter"

stems_affixes.word_buile: prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ive……的→adj.抑制的,价格昂贵的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ed……的→adj.放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
exhibit[v.展出,陈列 n.展览品,陈列品]+ion表名词→n.展览会;陈列,展览
exhibition[n.展览会;陈列,展览]+ist人→n.喜欢出风头的人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
stems_affixes.word_buile: inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ion表名词→n.抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ion表名词→n.禁止;禁令,禁律
pro前面+hibit拿住→在前面拿住→不让前进→禁止
